# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

function wrap_string(text, text_width = 10)
    lines = []
    for word in split(text)
        line_str = ""
        for char in word
            if length(line_str) + 1 > text_width
                push!(lines, line_str)
                line_str = ""
            end
            line_str += char
        end
        if line_str != ""
            push!(lines, line_str)
        end
    end
    return join(lines, '\n')
end

# Example usage:
text = "Hello there! This is a very long sentence that should wrap at the 10-character mark."
println(wrap_string(text))
# Output:
# Hello there!\nThis is a very long sentence that should wrap at the 10-character mark.
